intro: Retinispora leptoclada, commonly known as the slender leaf retinispora, is a member of the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem and aromatic foliage. Retinispora leptoclada is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in horticulture.
